result.execSummary:
The defendant Shaan Rupert Raymond York was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

10:51   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with DefDefendant Shaan Rupert Raymond York in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Thorie guilty to counts 1 and 2 of information remaining counts to be dismissed may be used for read-in. S/W probation 3 years, restituion, DNA sample and surcharge, court costs.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant    Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  DEF PLEADS GUILTY to count 1 and count 2  Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of count 1 and 2.  Remaining counts dismissed but used for read-in. Uncharged cases may be used for restitution amount as well as condition of probation. Court orders S/W 3 years, DNA sample and surcharge, court costs, restitution $100 TBD in 30 days.  Appeal rights are given to the defendant.
